edu.wsu.KepheraSimulator
Class RobotControllerDirector

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--edu.wsu.KepheraSimulator.RobotControllerDirector
public class RobotControllerDirector
extends java.lang.Object

A RobotControllerDirector is a utility class used to load, manage, and unload controllers that extend RobotController.

Constructor Summary
RobotControllerDirector(CurrentRobotState currentRobotState)
          Initialize and create a new RobotControllerDirector.
 
Method Summary
protected  java.lang.String[] availableControllers()
          Return a String array of the controllers available to the application.

          Start the controller and return true if the controller started successfully.
protected  void stopAll()
          Terminate all controllers.
protected  void stopController(java.lang.String controllerName)
          Stop a running controller.

Constructor Detail

RobotControllerDirector

public RobotControllerDirector(CurrentRobotState currentRobotState)
Initialize and create a new RobotControllerDirector. The availiable controllers will be discovered and made available.

Parameters:
currentRobotState - a reference that allows access to the robot accessor methods.
Method Detail

availableControllers

protected java.lang.String[] availableControllers()
Return a String array of the controllers available to the application.

Returns:
the controller names

startController

protected boolean startController(java.lang.String controllerName)
Start the controller and return true if the controller started successfully. Only one instance of a particular controller can be loaded at one time. If the controller is already loaded or it failed to load, this method will return false.

Parameters:
controllerName - the name of the controller to load
Returns:
true on success; false otherwise.

stopController

protected void stopController(java.lang.String controllerName)
Stop a running controller. The controller is not guarenteed to terminate immediatly. The controller is simply informed that it is time to finish. The controller will then terminate itself when a safe state is reached.

Parameters:
controllerName - the name of the controller to stop

stopAll

protected void stopAll()
Terminate all controllers.

runningControllers

protected java.util.ArrayList runningControllers()
Provide a list of the running controllers.

Returns:
a list of controllers that are currently running
